params.json: {"query": "fantasy game dice rolling", "limit": 30, "fields": "id, score, name, playingtime, maxplayers, categories, families, mechanics, description, averageweight", "params": {"defType": "edismax", "qf": "name description categories^4 families mechanics^4", "boost": "if(and(gte(field(maxplayers,max),7),gte(field(playingtime,max),21)),2,1)", "fq": "averageweight:[1 TO *]", "ps": 2}}

docs.name: The King's Armory: 7th Anniversary Edition
docs.description:
The King's Armory

...is a 100% pure co-op honoring the truest mechanisms of the online Tower Defense video game genre with a new Heroic feel.

At the start of each game you'll build your own map, choose your own Hero, and then battle ferociously against waves of oncoming monsters.  Defeat every monster, on every wave, including their epic boss, and we all win.  But should you let the Castle Gate fall, the enemies will use the powerful Armory Weapon against you.  Who will win in this epic battle of good vs. evil?

You'll never go it alone, in the co-op, even if playing solo!  Your small but might army of Heroes will hire new recruits to help you defend the castle, such as Foot Soldiers, Archers, Sorcerers, Clerics, and Psionicists.

What's New in the 7th Anniversary Edition?

The King's Armory now features 43 gorgeous new minis for Heroes and Hirable Characters alike, upgraded component quality including dice balance and tower strength, upgraded art, a fully rewritten manual, and more streamlined play via a new double-sided Wave Card for Monster Selection options.

Throw in a minor rebalancing of foes, equipment, and reinforcements, a few updates to the graphic design, and a 3x bigger box to hold all the new stuff, and the 7th Anniversary edition will scratch your every itch for hero-based tower defense with an even greater focus on the fun!

docs.name: 仙剑奇侠传—逍遥游 (Chinese Paladin: XiaoYaoYou)
docs.description:
With the collapse of the Tower of Imprisoned Demons, the thousands of demons once again rampaged the earth. To avoid being overwhelmed by the creatures, the Great God Nuwa used the magic of returning to the soul to create the Xiaoyao Illusion that temporarily trapping dangerous demons in it.

The celestial heroes of all time and space have received the message from Nuwa: Please come to the Illusion to conquer the demons and save the common people! The number of powerhouses with the highest merits will get my reward-go back in time and change the thing that makes you most regrettable. Therefore, the powerhouses from all walks of life have packed their bags and set off for the Xiaoyao Illusion.

The players are divided into two teams, A and B, according to the number of players in the game. Each player plays a different hero with special skills. Players take their turns one by one. A turn includes several phases, during which you can trigger event cards, play scrolls, and get equipped. The most important phase is the Battle Phase, during which you can trigger a battle with monsters. Your teammates can support you and your opponents can interfere. Cards and skills can be used to influence the battle. If you win, you get the winning effect and may keep the monster as your pet, otherwise, you have to get punished for losing.

After the monster deck is empty, the team with higher points from pets wins! You can also win by killing all your opponents. Don't forget the love stories from the main video game because the heroes won't hesitate to sacrifice their lives to save their lovers!

docs.name: Pokémon TCG: Rumble
docs.description:
Pokémon TCG: Rumble, the new all-in-one multiplayer Pokémon Trading Card Game, combines TCG and board game elements, and serves as a great introduction to the Pokémon Trading Card Game.

Each Pokémon TCG: Rumble game allows up to seven players to open the box and compete in a true Battle Royale with the goal of being the last Pokémon standing. The fast-paced card game is played on a playmat where the simple roll of the dice can decide your fate.

To play the game, simply place your markers to guess which Pokémon cards will outlast the others, roll the Energy dice to figure out which move you can use…and roll the Target die to find out which Pokémon you will attack! Score points for each Pokémon you Knock Out and score even bigger if your marker is on the last Pokémon standing.

docs.name: Grotten: 1-Bit Deeper
docs.description:
Grotten is a minimalist dungeon crawler using physical tiles to generate and explore a dungeon, where you roll on random tables to fill the rooms with monsters, traps, loot, NPCs - and a final epic boss fight. The zine contains one-page rules and character creation, cut-out dungeon tiles and tokens, and lots and lots of random tables.

Grotten is perfect for both solo play, co-op, with or without a GM, as a quick and easy stand-alone game or to use as a dungeon in any fantasy system you are playing.

—description from the publisher

docs.name: Halo ActionClix
docs.description:
WizKids Inc., creator of runaway hit games like HeroClix® and Pirates of the Spanish Main™, announced today its agreement with Bungie Studios and Microsoft to develop a new collectible miniatures game (CMG) called Halo® ActionClix™.

The Halo ActionClix CMG brings the incredible content of the Halo universe to the tabletop via the award-winning Clix miniatures game engine. Players familiar with HeroClix and HorrorClix™ will be able to jump right into the action and enjoy brand-new game mechanics, including weapon swaps, figure re-spawning and vehicle-based combat.

The first Halo ActionClix set will feature more than 80 unique miniature figures from the Halo universe, including preview content from Halo 3. A number of vehicle packs are also being produced, including a big surprise planned for San Diego Comic-Con this July. Figures will be sold in randomized Booster Packs. The vehicles and a Starter Game will be sold in a diorama display format.

Taken from the Wizkids press release.

Release date was September 19th, 2007

Home Page: http://www.wizkidsgames.com/halo/

docs.name: Apocalypso
docs.description:
Only one of you will escape the Island alive. Who will that be? Apocalypso is a fast-paced dice game where players aim to be the last one standing. The game starts with the youngest player and moves clockwise from there. Each player gets to roll the dice up to three times to achieve their desired roll.

This is a fun and exciting party game that requires strategy and luck. With its easy-to-follow rules and quick gameplay, it's a great choice for game night with friends and family.

—description from the publisher

docs.name: House Of Influence
docs.description:
House of Influence takes place in a historical age of diplomacy where influence is everything. Set after a war that has ravaged the lands people thought the golden age of peace had finally arrived. But underneath deceptive smiles the five different houses are still fighting for power and will use any means to become the house at the top: Influential people with unique skills are at the houses’ disposal to win the game. Be it the selfless Martyr who will sacrifice everything to gain influence for their house, the idealistic diplomat and her silver tongue, the valiant general or other powerful roles.
Which house will win? A house that holds honor and valor in high regard or a house preferring the subtle tactics of a cunning Charlatan?

House of Influence is a Team vs Team semi co-op Hidden role game where 3-10 players become members of a majority or minority. But players need to be careful, their allies might not be who you think they are. In order to accumulate the highest influence score in four rounds, the houses have up to 6 different characters at their disposal to manipulate the flow of influence and information.In this turn-based game each player rolls two available characters with their own set of abilities but can only use one to gather influence or information on the other players.

The appeal of House of Influence is the quick pace of the game with easy to understand rules automated and managed by the game app and unidice - the digitized die. Replayability in this Social Deduction game of intrigue and information is guaranteed. The different houses give different advantages to their house members and the characters at their disposal - depending on the flow of the game. This Hidden Role game combines decision making with the fun of rolling a dice console in the shape of a D6.

-description from publisher

docs.name: Moonlight Brewers
docs.description:
CONTEXT
Moonlight Brewers is a game where you'll be playing Trappist monks competing in order to brew the best beer. And as you may guess, they can only do it when the moon is full and the Werewolves roam. Hunters and preys at the same time, the Werewolves are both a danger and the ingredient for the beer.
In order to make it through the night and to brew THE beer, you'll have to build amazing strategies, backed up by a good amount of luck.

HOW TO PLAY
- Pick up the ingredient you need to collect in this phase of brewing. 
- Better ingredient means harder to get and will make more noise.
- Hunt Werewolves as a special ingredient for you beer
- Too much noise and you will be hunted by the Weres
- The Monk with the best beer win the game.

CONTENT
Print & Play game
1 MONASTERY (board)
1 RULES BOOKLET
63 CARDS (19 MONKS, 18 WERE, 13 EQUIPMENTS, 13 BENEDICTIONS)
8 MODS
1 SCARY SHEET
26 SMALL CARDS
THE CAMPAIGN OF THE WHITE WOLF

MORE CONTENT
Hermit Brewer - A solo mode extension : included in basic version
The Night of the Beast : included in basic version

—description from the publisher

docs.name: Fantasy Map Maker
docs.description:
Make your own fantasy world by unraveling its unique landscape and points of interest.
In each play, you will be filling out a tech tree, known as the feature wheel, that adds different terrain types and buildings to your map.
Fantasy Map Maker is designed to be not just a game, but a system for creating maps for roleplaying or other world-building purposes.

—description from the designer

docs.name: Legend of the Eight Isles
docs.description:
Choose to play together as the Legends and save the world or take on the mantle of the Foe and destroy them.

The Legends
Take a Legend card and use your weapons, skills and abilities to work together to accomplish objectives and complete tasks.

The Foe
Use your barracks full of fighters to stop the Legends from completing their objective. Eliminate them to gain bonuses and conquer the world.

The Battleboard and Encounter Cards
Each battle take place on the Battleboard. the Encounter Cards explain how to setup the terrain and objectives.

Once the Battleboard is set, the players take turns moving and using actions to complete the objectives or eliminate all of the Legends.

—description from the designer

docs.name: Welcome to Dino World
docs.description:
Description from the designer:

Build and manage your own dinosaur park in this strategic roll and write game for 1 or more players.

Roll dice, draw pens and try not to let any dinosaurs escape!

Each turn players share an expanding dice pool to work through three phases: add dinosaurs and buildings to the park, draw paths connecting attractions to the entrance, and control dinosaurs attempting to escape.

The game ends whenever a player runs out of space in their park, or has had too many dinosaurs escape.

The player with the most fame from dinosaurs/attractions and the fewest penalties from breakouts is the winner!

Welcome To DinoWorld is the official game of GenCant 2017!

docs.name: Fantasy Food Truck
docs.description:
What if you had a food truck in a fantasy world? In Fantasy Food Truck you get to live this out! Personalize it by naming your food truck, making a logo, and creating your menu. Level up your staff (Rogue, Artificer, Bard, Wizard, Ranger, and Barbarian) in order to better explore the surrounding area. Discover new customers (Gnomes, Goblins, Merfolk, Dwarves, Elves, and Orcs), defeat dangerous skeletons, tame wild dragons, and find hidden treasures. Earn the most stars to have the best fantasy food truck.

Fantasy Food Truck is a free print and play roll and write. It is all on one page and uses just four dice. Played over twelve rounds, you will advance tracks and also place polyominoes on the map. It can be played solo or up to 100+ players, all players will use the same dice rolls and see who can score the highest from those same rolls.

—description from designer

docs.name: Doom Cat
docs.description:
You're a young witch learning the ropes of magic. Unfortunately, your mischievous cat found your spell book and summoned demons!

In Doom Cat, you must learn how to draw sigils. You start with 2 magic circle pages filled with numbered candles. Roll 3 dice and draw a line between 2 of the candles matching two of the dice. The cat steals the other die and knocks over a matching candle, making it unusable in future rounds. The game ends after 14 rounds. Highest score wins. Solo players must score 70 or more points per sigil card to win.

Doom Cat comes with many goal cards that immerse you deeper into the world of sigil magic. Shuffle and play with a few random ones, or play them in order, progressively increasing the difficulty. Each scoring criteria incentivizes emergent beauty, giving each player a unique sigil each time!

—description from the publisher
families: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces

docs.name: Iron & Ale
docs.description:
GRAB YOUR ALE AND GROW YER BEARDS! PROVE YOUR DWARVEN STRENGTH. FIGHT AND DRINK FOR HONOR!

Iron & Ale is 100% Dwarf. It is a game of mining, fighting monsters, drinking and dwarven challenges. You are a Dwarven Lord challenging other players to become the true Dwarven King. To do this you must lead your clan to conquer the mountain and challenge other Dwarven Lords at the Meadhall. The Dwarven Lord with the most honor when the Mountain Deck is depleted wins.

The mountain is vast and full of riches guarded by sworn enemies. The mountain is made up of 100 cards filled with monsters, iron ore and gold. Sworn Dwarven enemies, such as Orc tribes, Giants, Trolls, the Legendary Dragon and more lurk in the mountain deck. During the Mountain Phase each player draws one card, exploring and mining the mountain. Every kill, every resource brings honor to your clan.

docs.name: Dice Quest
docs.description: Dice Quest is a pseudo fantasy role-playing game that was designed to have the minimum elements of an RPG, without being an actual RPG.  The game mechanics allow players to create their own RPG-style adventurers who possess a Character Class, Hit Points and Experience Points for leveling up.  Each pocket-sized game box includes 4 Specialty Dice, the game rules, a pad of Character Sheets and pad of graph paper for laying out the dungeon.  The four specialty dice included with Dice Quest substitute the need for a game moderator or "Dungeon Master" and allow players to create the labyrinth, encounter monsters, resolve combat and collect treasure while on their dungeon outing.

docs.name: Sedmiměstí
docs.description:
Game is played in the country "SedmimÄ›stí" ("Seven-cities"). There are six ordinary cities on the board and one magic - The seventh. Goal of the game is reach the magic city which is located on an island in the middle of the board. To get into the magic city you need to know names of three magic items.

It's a game of fun and parody, combining strategic games and RPG. Very quick game setup.

Box contents:
- 1 colorful board 60 x 60 cm in two variants
- 21 hero cards
- 25 fortune cards (magic items and beings)
- 33 encounter cards
- 3 six-sided dice
- 33 plastic card stands
- 1 list of magic items
- rules

docs.name: HEXplore It: The Forests of Adrimon
docs.description:
The forests were once populated by the elves of old- stewards of nature and protectors of the realm of fey. They departed nearly a century ago, emptying their pristine cities. Slowly the settlements were repopulated by other races and culture eventually returned to their walls.

Now, however, the peoples of the forest kneel to one enigmatic sorceress named Adrimon. All who enter slowly succumb to her presence, eventually becoming mindless slaves bound to her will. The cities are now lost, havens only to the mind-wiped. They work tirelessly on the Magi's automatons, enormous constructs fueled by the souls she has bound.

There have been heroes who have faced her and failed. In each attempt, they sacrificed themselves, vowing an oath that just might lead to Adrimon's undoing. These oaths gave power to their equipment creating relics that can diminish her magic, but they have been broken to pieces and scattered throughout the land. It is whispered that the only way Adrimon can be defeated is to find these relic fragments and piece them together.

Enter the Forests of Adrimon and attempt to gather the relic fragments, creating powerful equipment that may help destroy the sorceress. Players will be able to gain Favors from the spirits of the heroes who came before them, sneak into the mind-wiped cities, move though the fey-realm and interact with the Dryad (a powerful ally), battle tough foes and even save some of them from the Magi's wrath. There are hundreds of unique scenarios that can affect each game.

Team up to create your heroes and unseat the terrible sorceress, freeing the mind-wiped from their terrible enslavement.

—description from the publisher

FAQ with Official Answers

docs.name: Pencils & Powers
docs.description:
Description from the designer:

Pencils & Powers is a 1+ Player Roll & Write adventure game system. Roll 3d6 and then assign the dice to exploring, monsters, and treasures.  With the ultimate goal of defeating monsters, gathering treasure, and improving your heroes before time runs out.

The game is playable solo or with your friends. All players play simultaneously from the same roll of the dice. However each will individually choose where to assign those dice. As the game progresses the heroes will gain access to rooms filled with monsters and treasure. The treasure gets richer, the heroes get stronger, and the monsters become more powerful as the game progresses.

The game ends when times runs out, your heroes are all dead, or you have defeated all of the monsters. A final score is tallied and an ultimate winner is declared.

There are currently 12 adventures available.

Ancient Evil Awakens (fantasy campaign)
- A1: The Dread Knight
- A2: The Forgotten King
- A3: The Crazed Alchemist
- A4: Dragon Castle Challenge
- A5: The Motherload Mine
- A6: Maze of the Minotaur

Red Alert! (sci-fi campaign)
- RA1: Asteroids!
- Alien Overrun

Other Adventures
- All Hallows Eve (halloween theme)
- The Cult of Cthulhu (cthulhu theme)
- Caverns of the Krampus (xmas theme)
- The Shadow Spire (fantasy theme)

docs.name: Swindler's Chest
docs.description:
The Swindler's Chest includes all gameplay content from Emerald Skulls and Goblin Vaults. The chest also includes a double-sided playmat (one side for each game) and 3 plastic trays for easy game setup and storage. Additionally, the larger box supports sleeved cards for both games!

This Swindler's Chest includes the following items (all sold separately):

Emerald Skulls (base game content)
Emerald Skulls: 7-8 Player Expansion
Goblin Vaults (base game content)
Goblin Vaults: Gundur Pack + Chaos & Order (Mini Expansions)
Swindler's Playmat

Admin Note: This entry is set up to reflect the above but the Swindler's Chest was also sold with only Emerald Skulls and its expansion. This entry is also meant to represent that version too.

docs.name: Eight Epics
docs.description: Eight Epics is a cooperative dice game in which the heroic players must overcome unprecedented crises through the powers available to them and the ability to roll dice. A hero's capacity for heroics is finite, however, so you need to prevent the disaster before you run out of life.

docs.name: Merchants of Magick: A Set a Watch Tale
docs.description:
In Merchants of Magick, which takes place in the "Set a Watch" universe, you are the owner of a magic item shoppe, crafting items and research­ing spells to sell to the Adventurers of the Watch.

Each round, four polyhedral dice are rolled, then you select two of them to craft items or research enchantments for your shoppe. As you craft items and research spells, you start stocking items and earn potions that let you manipulate the dice. Adventurers travel from shoppe to shoppe, so you need to stock the exact items on the order cards in front of you. If you have an item an Adventurer needs, you earn coin — but if you wait too long to fulfill an order, Adventurers will become impatient and visit your competitor next door!

After ten rounds, the player who has earned the most coin wins.
families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina
Series: Set a Watch (Rock Manor Games)

docs.name: Freelancers: A Crossroads Game
docs.description:
Congratulations! Humanity is dead! The bad news is that all they left behind is their garbage and a broken gig economy. That's why we need freelancers like you who are ready to take any job, no matter how loathsome. As a freelancer, you will delve into ruins, brave the wilds, and slay the hordes of hideous creatures that litter the dark forgotten corners of the world. All so you can gather loot and return home, ready to blow it all and start over again the next day. It's a lousy gig, so it's perfect for the likes of you.

Freelancers: A Crossroads Game condenses the fantasy RPG campaign experience into a single night of fun and mayhem. Create a character, roll funky dice, and blaze your way through multiple stories set in a world of magic, monsters, and murder. Better yet, no game master is required, as a magical companion app does all the storytelling for you! Immerse yourself in fully-voiced, industry-leading audio as you play. Explore hundreds of branching paths in five highly replayable campaigns. Mix and match a multitude of species and jobs to build your own unique character. Pick up and play, simple rules, low commitment and no prep.

—description from the publisher
families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

docs.name: Home Raiders
docs.description:
Home Raiders is a game played with small scale models. These models represent the combatants that travel from a dimension known as the Inner-space to your very home, in order to battle for the dominance of your space. These fighters are little folk (which means that the scale of the models is actually 1:1) which exist in dimensions parallel to ours, and crash our world in order to thrive in theirs.

The basic game is very easy to grasp, and is a great option for a fast game that takes place in your actual living room coffee table, your office desk, or even around your kitchen sink. It takes no time at all to set up, so you can get your dice rolling in a breeze. If you are an experienced gamer, Home Raiders is a great choice for an improvised gaming session or even a well laid out match amongst a bunch of friends. If you want to play with your younger brothers and sisters, cousins or even your children, you won't find a better option to getting them started with this amazing hobby.

docs.name: The Hobbit: Hunt For The Arkenstone
docs.description:
Embark on an epic quest with Hunt for the Arkenstone, a cooperative board game inspired by the thrilling scenes from The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies.

In this adventure, players assume the roles of the brave members of Thorin Oakenshield's Company, including Dwarves and Hobbits. Working together, they must search the vast lands of Middle-earth to find the legendary Arkenstone and return it to Erebor's throne room.

To succeed, you'll need to explore every corner of Middle-earth, using your character's unique abilities and the support of your allies. Along the way, you’ll discover valuable items to aid in your quest. But beware—Azog and his ruthless Orcs are hot on your trail, determined to stop you at any cost.

Hunt for the Arkenstone is a legendary adventure for Thorin Oakenshield and his Company, brought to life in this complete boxed game. Perfect for any fan of Middle-earth, it offers an immersive experience in a single box.

—description from the publisher

docs.name: Paper Dungeons: A Dungeon Scrawler Game
docs.description:
Prepare your adventurers for a challenging dungeon exploration in Paper Dungeons, a roll-and-write game that seeks to reproduce the feel of a dungeon-crawler.

In the game, you control a classic group of medieval adventurers: warrior, wizard, cleric, and rogue. In each of the nine rounds, you select three of the six rolled dice and use these results to raise the level of your characters, produce magic items, obtain healing potions, and explore the dungeon to face challenges and collect treasure. You'll also find three large monsters waiting in the dungeon, and you can fight them for glory.

In the end, whoever collects the most glory wins.

docs.name: Storm Hollow: A Storyboard Game
docs.description:
Storm Hollow: A Storyboard Game is an amazing storytelling adventure game for all ages. One player assumes the role of the Storyteller, while the others are heroes called to the magical land of Storm Hollow to aid in a time of need.

Each game session provides a stand-alone adventure scenario with a specific story-driven goal for the players to try to accomplish, and multiple adventures can be strung together in campaign mode to experience fully interactive epic stories. Players work together to fight monsters, overcome obstacles, rescue characters, find lost treasures, and drive back the darkness using a simple skill-based system and unique heroic powers.

In Storm Hollow story is king, and a clever game system encourages creative decisions and amazing outcomes. Play pre-made adventures or use the numerous tools to make your own.

The box includes a "Battle for Storm Hollow" variant, which is a pure co-op game (no storyteller required).

docs.name: Semifinal Fantasy
docs.description:
Are you ready for some dungeoncrawling?

It's time for Semifinal Fantasy, where you (the average townsfolk) get to go down to your local tavern, pick your favorite adventurers, and place bets on which party will survive the nasty Bracket Dungeon!

From the comfort of your wooden barstool, you will try to convert your coins into a big haul. Now let's get thing rolling...

In Semifinal Fantasy you are a villager, hanging out in your local tavern, betting on which band of merry adventurers will survive each path of a dungeoncrawl. You will pick your adventurers, spend your coins to boost their stats, and then sit back and watch as the dice determine their fate in the old Bracket Dungeon. You'll also place bets on your favorite groups, trying to gain complete sets of Red, Green and Purple coins. In the end, all of your adventurers may be dead and gone, but you can still be the king of Semifinal Fantasy!

—description from the publisher

docs.name: Eight Epics: Hakkenden
docs.description: Shin Satomi hakkenden (æ–°é‡Œè¦‹å…«çŠ¬ä¼, literally "New Legend of the Eight Dogs of Satomi"), aka Eight Epics: Hakkenden, is a licensed version of Seiji Kanai's Eight Epics  that draws on Toshio Kamata's 1982 novel of the same title – which was also the basis of Kadokawa's 1983 movie Legend of the Eight Samurai (é‡Œè¦‹å…«çŠ¬ä¼ Satomi hakkenden) – for its setting, with players trying to use the dice-manipulation powers of the eight characters in the game to chase away evil spirits.

docs.name: RUN
docs.description:
A gateway board game that expertly balances the simplicity of traditional platforms with lite deck building and co-operative strategy.

Randomly select a character & place your pawns. (Each character has a different ability with which to support the team during play.) Select the dungeon boss & place its pawn. (Unique bosses create dynamic gameplay & allow for great expansion opportunities!)

Begin the players round. Each player draws from the Discovery deck, resolves play cards, then rolls for their movement. Begin chase round. The bosses do not enter the dungeon until after their Delay. Once in play, bosses move based on their speed + abilities. Fallen allies seek vengeance. Any players who have fallen to peril will draw from the VENGEANCE DECK and will attack the active players! Repeat rounds until the game is complete and  you were able to run out of the dungeon.

The 2nd Edition will feature improved instructions, updated character tokens, an updated board, and each of our 211 cards are being rewritten to reduce unnecessary terms and provide players with an overall improved play ability across the board (no pun intended).

—description from the designer

docs.name: Encounters: Shadowrun
docs.description:
The year is 2078. The worlds’ megacorporations straddle the sprawls of the Sixth World, goliaths that intimidate even nations as they suck in souls in their drive for the almighty nuyen. Between the cracks, shadowrunners carve out a living as deniable and disposable assets that megacorps fire at each other for datasteals, personnel extractions, or even wetwork. Whether casting manabolts of magic, riding the electrons of the Matrix with just the brain, or slinging good, old-fashioned flying lead while firing at speed enhanced by the latest in bio-engineering, runners live dangerously and hope their skills are good enough to let them survive another day.

Encounters: Shadowrun is a 1-8 player fast-paced, pushed-your-luck dice and card game. Players take the role of Mr. Johnson, arranging the megacorps’ dirty work and adding new shadowrunners to their already-assembled teams. They send their teams into the shadows of the mean sprawl streets of the Sixth World, collecting though paydata to beat down their rivals. Grab some dice, make a team, and show ’em who’s the boss.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to acquire ¥30. 
Each player starts the game with (1) runner and 6 dice. At the start of your turn you flip over location card, that has effects aka breaks the rules, on every turn until a new environment card comes into play. You then flip over the top Event card form the deck and try and roll an exact match of the number on the card. If you succeed you place a die on the. You could stop then and receive ¥1 or flip a card and continue to press your luck. If you fail the next player starts a new run with a chance to collect n the ¥ you forfeited.

¥ are used as victory points as well as currency to buy additional runners.
